Authors: Benjamin W. van Ee, Paul E. Berry
Title:
Croton section Pedicellatus (Euphorbiaceae), a novel new
world section of Croton, including the description of Croton
breedlovei
Keywords:
Croton breedlovei, disjunction, section Pedicellatus,
section Lamprocroton, Euphorbiaceae, molecular phylogeny
Abstract:
Croton section Pedicellatus, with a disjunct distribution
in Mexico and South America, is described. This new section is recovered
sister to section Lamprocroton in Bayesian and Maximum Likelihood
analyses of nuclear ITS and chloroplast trnL-F DNA sequence data. Croton
breedlovei, a new lepidote species of section Pedicellatus endemic to
Chiapas, Mexico is described. The two Mexican members of section
Pedicellatus, C. breedlovei and C. tenuilobus, are not recovered sister
to each other in the phylogenetic analyses, possibly indicating two
separate dispersal events from South America. This result is
corroborated by the morphological evidence given that C. breedlovei is
phylogenetically closer to other lepidote species from Brazil than it is
to the stellate C. tenuilobus.
